subject: Coming Soon to a Bookstore Near You...
event: ... if you happen to live in Brazil. September 1 is the official release date for the first Brazilian edition of A GAME OF THRONES, to be published by Leya. The Brazilian editions will sport the beautiful Marc Simonetti art from the recent French reissues. Just thought I'd give you all a peek: This will be the first of my books to be published in Brazil. Or, indeed, anywhere in South America. A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE is now on five continents. I only need to conquer Africa and Antarctica to have the whole set...

comments.article: As a Brazilian who's been reading Song of Ice and Fire ever since the books were first released, I'm happy to see them translated into Brazilian Portuguese. Congratulations, George!

Para-bens!  O povo do Brasil deve estar muito feliz por este dia.

comments.article: Hope you can read this after almost 3 months from the post. I feel a certain duty to relate this, considering that it might never have been mentioned to you. I've taken a look at the Brazilian version of ASOIAF, and, considering the contact I've had with the original version, the impression I get is that it was written by Edgar Allan Poe or some other really old writer. Translation has created a distorted version of your story. My guess is there was no translation, just appropriation from the Portuguese version. And here I must make something clear: Brazilian Portuguese is something entirely different from Portuguese Portuguese. Since the books had already been published in Portugal, it seems the same translation has been used here in Brazil, maybe with only some minor changes. That has greatly disappointed me, for I can see the distance it stands from the original work. And I had great expectations for other readers to have the opportunity to read those books, with the same ease I had to read them in the original version. But it's gonna be really hard for them to do that. Maybe you already know this, maybe you don't. Like I said, I felt responsible for the warning. Not sure about what can be done, if anything at all is necessary. Good luck to you. I know you'll have it.
comments.subject: Warning about the Brazilian version
